title: Beads validation test - implement dummy feature
description: Test task for beads integration validation. Verify that: 1) tasks can be created, 2) dependencies work, 3) bd ready shows correct work, 4) claim/close workflow works.

title: Add VCS prerequisites section to SDLC.md
description: Add explicit git initialization steps as Sprint 0 gate. Include: git init, identity config, initial commit, beads hooks, .gitignore verification. Document this as a mandatory prerequisite before ANY sprint starts.

title: Add git requirement to BEADS-QUICK-REF.md
description: Document that git is required for beads hooks (bd hooks install) and sync operations.

title: Add git initialization to AOF project bootstrap
description: Enhance bootstrap.ts/create.ts to check for git repo existence and optionally initialize it. Add CLI flag for --git-init during project creation. Fail gracefully with clear error if git not found.

title: Beads integration complete - notify main agent
description: All phases complete: installation, agent doc updates, task migration, validation. Beads is now the task management system for AOF.

title: Add tests for git bootstrap logic
description: Test coverage for git check/init in project creation. Test cases: git present, git missing, git init flag, error handling.

title: OpenAI Codex + AOF Subagent Integration
description: Codex recently added subagent support. Same pattern as Claude Code integration: AOF as governance layer, Codex as execution runtime. Evaluate whether Codex's subagent API allows deterministic dispatch (vs. model-decided) and whether MCP or another protocol is the right bridge.

title: Beads validation test - write tests
description: Write tests for the dummy feature (blocks the main task)

title: Claude Code + AOF MCP Integration
description: AOF exposes MCP server → Claude Code connects as client → uses AOF tools to pick up tasks, get context from inputs/, spawn subagents to execute, write to outputs/. AOF handles governance (kanban, runbooks, dispatch), Claude Code handles execution (LLM loop, tool use, subagents).
